[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Interstate-15 RLCS defines automated lane control requirements to improve traffic flow and safety.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Interstate-15 automates reversible lanes to optimize capacity during peak hours and events.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Interstate-15 integrates with ATMS-2 for traffic monitoring and FasTrak for toll processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Interstate-15 provides dashboards for lane control and monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Interstate-15 supports lane controllers, sensors, and DMS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Interstate-15 uses APIs for ATMS integration and traffic control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Interstate-15 ensures secure real-time control communication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Interstate-15 ensures continuous operation with failover.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Interstate-15 adapts to roadway environments and traffic needs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Interstate-15 supports integration with analytics, incident detection, and enforcement systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Interstate-15 automates lane control, monitoring, and reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Interstate-15 is for traffic operators and agencies.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Interstate-15 relies on fiber optics and lane control compatibility.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Interstate-15 assumes ATMS-2 and FasTrak integration.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with ATMS-2 and FasTrak for real-time data exchange (REQ-FUNC-001, REQ-PERF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall monitor and control lane states (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate operational reports (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a multilingual interface and customizable alerts for operators (REQ-FUNC-001, REQ-PERF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process lane state changes within 2 seconds (REQ-ATTR-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 50 concurrent users (REQ-ATTR-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store operational data and retain logs for 1 year (REQ-FUNC-002, REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support modular design for scalability and comply with ISO 27001 security guidelines (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall align with RLCS operational guidelines (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale dynamically based on traffic demands (REQ-PERF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log all critical activities for auditing (REQ-PERF-002).

[SEC] 3. Verification: System, integration, and performance testing to ensure compliance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, troubleshooting guides, and training materials.
[SEC] 5. References: Caltrans RLCS Documentation and related operational guidelines.
